channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fact-Checking the Debate
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa traded barbs over the police, prostitution and President Trump.

item.title: U.S. Says Louisiana Man Joined Hamas-Led 2023 Attack on Israel
item.description: A man was in custody after federal prosecutors accused him of joining Gazan militants in attacking Israel on Oct. 7, 2023. He was also accused of lyin...

item.title: Warren Buffett plowed more than $1 billion into three stocks, and it says a lot about where he sees consumers’ priorities right now: Houses, beer, and gas
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway's 2025 investments focus on consumer-driven brands like Lennar, Chevron, and Constellation.

item.title: The secrets and rituals behind the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Europe
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: What Are Tomahawk Missiles, and Why Might Trump Give Them to Ukraine?
item.description: Ukraine could receive a newly developed land-based launcher to strike Moscow and beyond.

item.title: Asymmetric Capital Partners raises $137 million second fund, beating ZIRP-era odds
item.description: Asymmetric has raised its $137 million second fund, passing its original $125 million target, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: From Belém to the world: a financial approach to climate and inclusion
item.description: Now is the time to make bold commitments to protect our planet and care for people.

item.title: The Top Zingers of the Mayoral Debate
item.description: The two-hour slugfest produced some memorable one-liners, on subjects ranging from the candidates’ parents to imaginary sports championships.

item.title: Vivienne Westwood Show Opens Riyadh Fashion Week, as Saudis Highlight Creative Side
